FuncDef:
The fr lmi n392dte command configures an error threshold (N392) used for LMI negotiation on a DTE.
The undo fr lmi n392dte command restores the default configuration.
By default, the N392 value is 3 on a DTE.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies an error threshold used for LMI negotiation on a DTE.
The value is an integer ranging from 1 to 10.

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
Local Management Interface (LMI) is a protocol that uses status enquiry messages and state messages to maintain link and PVC status, and its working process is as follows:
To request the PVC status, a DTE sends a status enquiry message at an interval specified by T391 to a DCE. Upon receipt of the message, the DCE replies with a status message that carries the requested status information. If the DTE does not receive such a status message during the specified period, the DTE records the error and increases the number of error events by 1. If the number of error events reaches the error threshold (N392), the DTE considers the physical link and all VCs unavailable. To configure an error threshold on a DTE, run the fr lmi n392dte command.
Prerequisites
The FR interface type has been set to DTE using the fr interface-type command.
Configuration Impact
Running the fr lmi n392dte command changes the error threshold, which affects the LMI negotiation rate.
If the fr lmi n392dte command is run more than once, the latest configuration overrides the previous one.
Precautions
N393 indicates the total number of monitored events. N392 indicates the error threshold. N392 and N393 work together to determine the error threshold.
The value of N392 must be smaller than that of N393 on a DTE.
